T20 World Cup: UAE offers hope of first smile — but can Canada capitalise?
description: In the T20 World Cup 2026 “Group of Death”, New Zealand and South Africa lead while Afghanistan struggles, and UAE and Canada remain winless. Their clash on Friday is a key chance for a breakthrough victory. Canada gained confidence despite losses, while both teams prepared seriously, stressing equal opportunity and the need for more chances to play top nations to bridge the experience gap.

title: Trump revokes basis of U.S. climate regulation, ends vehicle emission standards
description: The move marks the administration’s most extensive rollback of climate change policy, following a series of regulatory cuts aimed at promoting fossil fuel development and hindering clean energy

Durgam cheruvu: A glittering view, a gasping lake
description: The gem-like appearance of Durgam Cheruvu hides a sinister, calculated assault. As evening lights and rooftop views sell the lake as a tourist spot, a multi-agency process seems to be killing it softly. One civic body lowers the water level to free up land, another lays a 10-metre-wide walking track on the exposed lake bed and yet another releases organically loaded effluents that fuel decay. Once a source of drinking water and part of Golconda Fort’s hydrological system, the lake is now trapped in a bureaucratic tic-tac-toe, writes Serish Nanisetti

title: Indian student killed by US officer: Father died 2 days before Rs 262 crore settlement
description: In a somber turn of events, the city of Seattle has agreed to pay $29 million to the grieving family of Jaahnavi Kandula, a bright Telugu student tragically lost to a police car's reckless speed. This settlement emerges just as her father, Constable Kandula Srikanth, passed away—adding to the family's heartache.

title: VB-G RAM G: when a policy shift meets rural realities
description: While the Centre maintains that VB-G RAM G is an improved version of MGNREGA, critics  say it dilutes the legal right to employment guaranteed under the earlier law. The primary stakeholders, the job card holders, may not be familiar with the technical details of the new Act, but their concern is straightforward: they want assured and adequate work so that the scheme genuinely serves its purpose of livelihood security, finds out P. Sujatha Varma

title: Trapped for 12 hours after bike falls into mud-filled pit, UP man dies
description: A 25-year-old man died after being trapped for nearly 12 hours in a mud-filled pit on a deserted road in Kanpur Dehat. Dhirendra Kumar's motorcycle fell into the pit on Tuesday night, and he was discovered by farmers the next morning. Despite rescue efforts and hospital treatment, he succumbed to his condition.

description: India showcased their destructive batting prowess with blistering half-centuries from Ishan Kishan and Hardik Pandya, posting a formidable 209/9 against Namibia. Kishan's rapid 61 and Pandya's 52 ensured India maintained momentum, extending their record of 200-plus T20I totals to 47.

Nurse who contracted Nipah virus dies of secondary infections; 200 contacts test negative
description: A 25-year-old female nurse, infected with the Nipah virus, has died from secondary infections after a 37-day battle. She succumbed to sepsis and other complications at Barasat Hospital. The male nurse, also infected, has recovered and is doing well at home. No close contacts tested positive.

title: Centre rejects Sixth Schedule, statehood for Ladakh, offers 'territorial council'
description: Ladakh's major political groups, LAB and KDA, were informed by the Centre that neither Sixth Schedule status nor statehood will be granted. Instead, a 'territorial council' model was proposed, which leaders dismissed as a 'farce.'  Disagreements arose over the Sixth Schedule's effectiveness and Ladakh's financial viability for statehood.

title: Bad Bunny, Kendall Jenner spark buzz after Super Bowl LX show

Soon after the show, rumors of the two rekindling their romance have sparked chaos. Amid this, a clip of two leaving in his luxurious car has sparked panic as many believe the two have got back together.

title: Bucket of water thrown at historian S Irfan Habib at Delhi University: 'Disturbing, shocking'
description: Historian S Irfan Habib had a bucket of water thrown at him by an unidentified individual during an event at Delhi University's Arts Faculty. The incident occurred while Habib was addressing students at the People's Literature Festival, organized by AISA. AISA alleged ABVP involvement, which ABVP denied, calling the accusations baseless.

title: Lauren Kyle turns heads in Milan as Connor McDavid eyes opener
description: Connor McDavid and Team Canada have arrived in Milan for the 2026 Winter Olympics, beginning preparations for their opener against Czechia. McDavid skated on the top line in practice and shared candid remarks about the Olympic Village and adjusting to jet lag. Off the ice, Lauren Kyle’s Instagram posts offered fans a personal look at life in Milan, highlighting family support and national pride. Canada, led by captain Sidney Crosby, aims to build on last year’s international success as Olympic competition begins.
